But the true star of the evening was the crepe.Perfectly thin and soft, with just the right balance of flavors. The ingredients were fresh, and the presentation was beautiful.

The staff was attentive and friendly, which made the experience even more enjoyable. If youâ€™re a fan of authentic French cuisineâ€”or just great crepesâ€”this place highly recommended ğŸ‘ğŸ»

Loved this place! Food was fantasticâ€”dessert nailed it. I am not a huge fan of orange but I love their crepe.
Outdoor areaâ€™s super chill, while the indoor spot feels cozy and quiet (AC bonus!). Big thanks to Frank, whoâ€™s really friendly and even gave me a mini tour of the restaurant. Perfect mix of vibes and flavors. Definitely coming back!

Chance upon this cafe, no reservation but we still got a table immediately.
All the staffs are very friendly and smiling all the time.
We tried their egg benedict and steak with fragrance rice. The bread is soft and steak was good.
Also their crepe, has a nice sour sweet taste which is different from our usual butter and cinnamon crepe that we tried before.

Had dinner at Chez Suzette. Itâ€™s a cosy place with a lovely French cottage vibe. The staff, especially Nathan and the owner, were friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better.

The starters were alright â€” the escargot was okay, though it could have used more garlic. The house pour red wine was served cold, so do check if you prefer it at room temperature.

The mains, however, were very good â€” tasty and satisfying. They really made the meal worth it.

Overall, Chez Suzette is a great spot if youâ€™re looking for a chill, easy-going place to enjoy dinner. Iâ€™d recommend it for a relaxed night out.
